meanings.definition: Cause (someone) to be a victim again.
meanings.sent1: Bullying can revictimize a person who has already been hurt.
meanings.sent2: The criminal's actions may revictimize the victim and cause more pain.
meanings.sent3: The movie plot revictimized the main character multiple times for dramatic effect.
meanings.sent4: The storm's destruction seemed to revictimize the already struggling community.
meanings.sent5: The news of the robbery would revictimize the elderly couple, bringing back their fear.

meanings.sent1: It is cruel to revictimize someone who is already suffering.
meanings.sent2: The scammer's goal was to revictimize unsuspecting individuals for personal gain.
meanings.sent3: The prankster thought it would be funny to revictimize his friend with a harmless joke.
meanings.sent4: The corrupt system continued to revictimize the marginalized communities.
meanings.sent5: The online trolls sought to revictimize their targets by spreading false information.
